subject: Re: [junit] Re: ANT and JUNIT Integration Problem

My quick analysis says that the "instrument" task is not 
re-instrumenting the class files when you run the "test" target. Run Ant 
in verbose mode to verify that. If so, it is because the Ant finds the 
files on which "instrument" operates to already be up to date.

Try this: make a change to a test then run "instrument". If that does 
nothing, then that's your answer.

As a hack, change "test" to depend on "compile, instrument". You 
shouldn't have to, but it appears for whatever reasons that you do.

I hope none of this is old hat and therefore is actually useful.
--
